org.xchain

Interface Registerable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EngineeredCommand
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTemplateCommand, ChooseCommand.WhenClause, TemporaryCommand

    public interface Registerable
    This interface is added to engineered commands, so that their registration information can be tracked. If a command is registered with a catalog, then isRegistered() will return true, the system id will be set to the system id of the catalog, and the qname will be set to the qname of the command in the catalog. If isRegistered() returns false, then the values of system id and qname are not defined. If a command needs registration information, it can be declared abstract and implement this interface without providing implementation for these methods. XChains will extend the command and provide implementations for the abstract methods.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.xml.namespace.QName getQName()
      If this command is registered, then the qname for this command is returned.
      java.lang.String getSystemId()
      If this command is registered, then the system id for the catalog it is registered in is returned.
      boolean isRegistered()
      Returns true if this command is registered with a catalog, false otherwise.
      void setQName(javax.xml.namespace.QName qname)
      Sets the registration qname for this command.
      void setSystemId(java.lang.String systemId)
      Sets the registration system id for this command.

    • Method Detail

      • isRegistered

        boolean isRegistered()
        Returns true if this command is registered with a catalog, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if this command is registered with a catalog, false otherwise.

      • getQName

        javax.xml.namespace.QName getQName()
        If this command is registered, then the qname for this command is returned. Otherwise, the result is undefined.
        Returns:
        the qname of this command, if it is registered. The result is undefined otherwise.

      • getSystemId

        java.lang.String getSystemId()
        If this command is registered, then the system id for the catalog it is registered in is returned. Otherwise, the result is undefined.
        Returns:
        the system id of the catalog to which this command is registered. If the command is not registered, then the result is undefined.

      • setQName

        void setQName(javax.xml.namespace.QName qname)
        Sets the registration qname for this command. This method should only be called by the XChain framework.
        Parameters:
        qname - the key for this command in the catalog.

      • setSystemId

        void setSystemId(java.lang.String systemId)
        Sets the registration system id for this command. This method should only be called by the XChain framework.
        Parameters:
        systemId - the system id of the catalog where this command is registered.
